comments.body: What happens if you use both `--list` and `--list-all`?

At the moment `--list` wins over everything. So if you say `--include=... --perf-tests=... --list` you still get the list of test suites. That's very much related to @cocreature's comment: we have a bunch of "flat" flags (i.e. no hierarchy) as far as the external interface is concerned, but internally we treat them as special things where some affect others. I think the tool has become rich enough that it's now worth having explicit subcommands, each which its own set of allowed flags.
